Description of incident: Over 100 University of Northern Iowa employees reported that their tax returns had been rejected in 2014 because someone had filed a return fraudulently on their behalf, collecting their refund. After further investigation, a 45 year old man, Bernard Ogie Oretekor has been charged with the tax indentity theft when computers belonging to Oretekor in connection with a separate investigation, uncovered the information on the employees. It is still not clear how Oretekor gained this information on the employees. More information: http://www.kcrg.com/content/news/Suspect-Charged-in-University-of-Northe...
